TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in Vratsa .
A.
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . Background

On DATE the applicant was adopted by PERSON Under a contract concluded on DATE the applicant undertook to provide DATE care for PERSON and for her ill sister until the end of their lives and to pay MONEY , in exchange of PERSON undertaking to transfer the ownership of her apartment to the applicant .

The applicant paid MONEY and discharged his care obligations properly until DATE when his relations with PERSON deteriorated . Since DATE the applicant and PERSON have been parties to several civil proceedings such as proceedings for annulment of the adoption , for enforcement and for rescinding of their DATE contract and for payment of compensation . A judgment of CARDINAL DATE established that the DATE contract was to be considered rescinded .
CARDINAL . The proceedings DATE

On DATE the applicant brought an action before ORG ( GPE съд ) against PERSON and CARDINAL other persons seeking , inter alia , restitution of the MONEY paid and of the value of the care and services furnished by him under the DATE contract . His action was based on the rule of prohibition of unjust enrichment ( неоснователно обогатяване ) as enshrined in LAW ( ORG за задълженията и договорите ) .

The court heard numerous witnesses and experts who established the services performed by the applicant and their value . The court held its last hearing on DATE and announced that the judgment would be delivered soon thereafter .

In DATE the applicant twice addressed the court asking for a speedy delivery of the judgment . In DATE and DATE he also sought to amend his claim arguing that the sharp increase in inflation since DATE had led to CARDINAL fold devaluation of the real value of the NORP currency .
The judgment , which was dated DATE , was delivered on DATE .

The court found that the applicant was entitled to restitution of all that he had given under the DATE contract . This right had arisen on DATE , the date on which the judicial decision confirming the rescission of the DATE contract had been delivered . It was further established that the services performed by the applicant and the food , heating fuel and other products provided by him to PERSON and her sister for the period DATE amounted to MONEY ( the MONEY paid by the applicant included ) , according to prices from the relevant period . The court therefore awarded to the applicant this amount , together with the established interest rate ( законна лихва ) , to be counted as from CARDINAL DATE , the date of bringing of the applicant 's action .

The parties appealed to ORG ( Βърховен съд ) which on DATE quashed ORG judgment under LAW ) of LAW ( PERSON процесуален кодекс ) and returned the case for renewed examination as there had been certain procedural irregularities . ORG was composed of CARDINAL justices , PERSON , Mr GPE and PERSON .
CARDINAL . The proceedings before ORG
The referred case was taken by ORG as there was not a sufficient number of judges at ORG .
ORG held CARDINAL hearings . At most of the hearings witnesses and experts were heard , evidence was admitted and oral submissions were made .

At the first hearing on DATE the applicant stated the evidence on which he would rely . He later decided to request the appointment of an expert and submitted a motion in writing on DATE . The court granted the request by decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the expert 's report was submitted to the court . The hearing listed for CARDINAL DATE was adjourned as there was no confirmation that one of the defendants had received the summons .
On DATE and DATE the applicant made submissions in writing amending his claim to reflect the inflation and requested the appointment of another expert . On DATE the request was granted .

On DATE the proceedings were suspended due to the death of CARDINAL of the defendants . The applicant was instructed to state whether he wished to pursue the action against the heirs and to provide their names and addresses . He did so on DATE . On DATE the expert appointed by the court filed his report .

The fourth hearing took place on DATE . Both parties requested leave to submit further evidence and to question witnesses . The applicant requested additional reports from the experts . The hearing was adjourned .
On DATE the court held a hearing . CARDINAL of the experts and CARDINAL of the witnesses for the applicant did not appear . The court decided to hold another hearing .
On DATE the applicant requested in writing that additional questions be put to the experts . Their answers were filed with the court on DATE .
On DATE the court held a hearing . An expert did not appear . The case was listed for a further hearing .
By written motion of DATE the applicant increased the amount of the claim in view of the inflation and requested leave to question CARDINAL additional witnesses .

The next hearing was on DATE . The applicant sought leave to put additional questions to CARDINAL of the experts and requested an adjournment as CARDINAL of his witnesses had not been able to attend .
On DATE the applicant requested in writing leave to have another witness examined . On DATE an additional expert 's report was filed .

The hearing on DATE was adjourned upon the request of the applicant who insisted on the questioning of a witness who had not appeared . On DATE and DATE the court rejected the applicant 's request for additional questions to CARDINAL of the experts .
On DATE the applicant requested in writing leave to have re - examined a witness who had already been questioned .

At the hearing on DATE , the ninth hearing in the case , CARDINAL of the witnesses was unable to attend . An expert 's opinion which was due had not been filed . The court listed the case for a further hearing .
On DATE the applicant made submissions in writing requesting further reports from the experts . This request was rejected .
The failure of a witness and of an expert to appear at the tenth hearing , which was held on DATE , prevented the conclusion of the proceedings .
On DATE the applicant requested in writing leave to have CARDINAL additional witnesses summoned and examined . The request was granted .

In the course of the eleventh hearing , on DATE , the applicant sought to increase the amount of the claim in view of the inflation . The case was adjourned as one of the defendants had not appeared and the relevant law required that all defendants be provided with an opportunity to comment on any amendment of the claim .
On DATE the applicant successfully requested the court to order an additional expert 's opinion . This was filed on DATE .
The hearing on DATE could not conclude the proceedings for the same reasons as those , which caused the adjournment of the hearing of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the applicant requested the further questioning of CARDINAL witnesses . This was granted .

The last hearing before ORG took place on DATE . Following all amendments of the amount of the claim , it was finally set by the applicant at MONEY as he insisted that the price levels of DATE should be used .

On DATE ORG delivered its judgment . It found that the applicant 's right to restitution of what he had given under the DATE contract had arisen on DATE . The court awarded to the applicant MONEY , together with the established interest rate , to be counted as from DATE , the date of the submission of the applicant 's action .
Addressing the applicant 's argument that the inflation should be taken into account the court found , inter alia :

" ... upon the rescission of a contract the parties are under the obligation to return whatever they have exchanged in order to restore the situation as it was prior to the execution of the contract . Therefore , the ORG finds that the claim is well - founded for its part up to MONEY ... and should be dismissed as ill - founded in its remaining part . "
CARDINAL . Appeal and review ( cassation ) proceedings
The applicant and the defendants appealed to ORG . On DATE the applicant requested in writing a speedy examination of the case .

The appeal was examined by a chamber of the ORG , which was composed of CARDINAL justices , CARDINAL of whom , PERSON and Mr GPE , had also participated in the examination of the case in DATE . The applicant did not request their removal . ORG heard the appeals on CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the appeals . According to LAW of MONEY plus interest became enforceable on DATE .
ORG found inter alia :

" The [ Regional ] Court correctly awarded restitution of the benefits on the basis of their value as of the moment of their bestowal , as this is the amount with which the [ applicant ] has actually become poorer . If the pecuniary equivalent of the furnished services were to be awarded under up - to - date prices , the [ applicant ] would have received more than that of which he was actually deprived . [ In cases ] of unjust enrichment the benefits bestowed are to be restituted up to the amount of the deprivation suffered . "
In DATE the applicant and the defendants submitted to a CARDINAL - member chamber of ORG petitions for review ( cassation ) ( преглед по реда на надзора ) against the judgments of DATE and DATE .
A hearing was listed for DATE . It was adjourned until DATE upon the applicant 's request in view of the unavailability of his legal representative .
The hearing on DATE was adjourned as the defendants had not been properly summoned .
The hearing eventually took place on DATE .
On DATE ORG , sitting in a CARDINAL - member chamber , dismissed the applicant 's petition for review
The ORG confirmed that according to the relevant law the applicant could not claim re - evaluation according to up - to - date prices .
Also , dealing with the applicant 's complaint that the same justices decided twice in his case , the court stated inter alia :

" ... the examination of the [ second appeal ] by the same chamber which had previously quashed the lower court 's judgment and had returned the case to it under LAW § CARDINAL of LAW not only is not a breach of procedure , but is desirable in view of the [ chamber 's ] cognizance of the matter and the [ need for ] economy ... The grounds under LAW § CARDINAL for returning a case to the first instance court are such that the [ appellate ] court does not decide on the merits . "
On DATE the defendants paid to the applicant the amount of MONEY , which represented the principal sum due plus interest .
B. Relevant domestic law and practice
The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
Section CARDINAL
" Anyone who has received something without a causa or pursuant to a causa which has not realised or has ceased to exist , shall be under the obligation to return it ... "
Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL :

" If the object to be restituted has been ... consumed by the beneficiary when he already knew that he possessed it without causa , the latter owes its real value ... However , if the object [ to be restituted ] has been ... consumed by the beneficiary before the invitation [ to return it ] the latter owes only that of which he has benefited ... "
According to the practice of ORG ( реш. GPE от QUANTITY на GPE на GPE по гр.д. No . CARDINAL ) :

" The consequence of the rescission of a bilateral contract is that the parties shall return whatever they have exchanged in order to restore the situation as it was prior to the execution of the contract . The restitution is due because the contract which had been the legal ground of the exchange has ceased to exist . The restitution ... is due under LAW of LAW ... "

The statutory default interest rate applicable to judicial awards is established by acts of ORG ( PERSON съвет ) . It was PERCENT per annum DATE and was , thereafter and during the relevant period of time , equal to the basic interest rate , as established by ORG , increased by CARDINAL points . At different periods of time DATE and DATE , when the judgment awarding MONEY to the applicant became enforceable , the interest rate thus varied DATE .

Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL(b ) of the Code of Civil Procedure provides that the appellate court has to refer the case back for renewed examination by the lower court where the latter 's judgment has been quashed because of a violation of the party 's right to fully participate in the proceedings .
